results.title: Ron Magliozzi and Jenny He interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'
results.brief_description: Jenny He (Curatorial Assistant, Department of Film) and Ron Magliozzi (Assistant Curator, Department of Film) are co-organizers of the Tim Burton exhibition, from MoMa (The Museum of Modern Art) in New York. Here they are interviewed by Kate Warren, ACMI’s Assistant Curator, about their work on ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’. They take us through the process, from inception, through to collaborating with Tim Burton, of Burton’s work and the curatorial process. As well as viewing Tim Burton’s work from an artistic perspective, we also gain insight into the art of the curator and curatorial perspective.

results.title: Ron Barassi's top 31 players
results.brief_description: Football legend Ron Barassi selects his top 31 players from the past 31 years of Australian Rules Football. His selections (in random order) are: Michael Tuck, Leigh Matthews, Robert Flower, Gerard Healy, John Nicholls, Ted Whitten, Kevin Bartlett, Paul Roos, Doug Wade, Simon Madden, Peter Daicos, Malcolm Blight, Roger Hart, John Rantall, Keith Greig, Francis Bourke, Tony Lockett, Stephen Kernahan, Geoff Southby, Ian Stewart, Darrel Baldeck, Alex Jesaulenko, Bob Skilton, Gary Ablett, Greg Williams, Wayne Schimmelbusch, Kevin Murray, Barry Cable, Bruce Doull, Graham Farmer, Peter Hudson. Features fantastic footage of some of the legends of the game performing at the height of their careers.

results.title: Ron and Mandi Heath: weavers
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
This film looks at the life style of Ron Heath, once a geologist and Mandi Heath who was a teacher, and their total commitment to their craft of weaving. They hope to make the farm on which they live self-sufficient and are continually experimenting with methods of weaving in their workshop which is in the nearby town.

results.title: Ron's story
results.brief_description: A wife remembers her wonderful life with her husband, who can now no longer remember it with her. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: Ron's story
results.creator_credit: Davide Grassi, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey
results.brief_description: Ron’s Story is a video based on the work and obsessions of Los Angeles-based extreme performance artist Ron Athey. The video is comprised of footage filmed at various performances staged at the Kapelica Gallery and the Cultural Centre Cankarjev dom in Ljubljana between 1996 and 2001.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Davide Grassi, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey

results.title: Romy and Michele's high school reunion
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Bungalow 78, Laurence Mark and David Mirkin
results.brief_description: Two friends - Romy and Michele - are ten years out of high school when they are invited to a class reunion. The two women have escaped their hometown for Los Angeles but things haven’t turned out quite as planned. Pouring over their high school yearbook provides the opportunity for a series of flashbacks about their (at times) gruesome school days. Four bitchy women - the A group - played a key part in Romy’s teenage angst, compounded by her crush on the boyfriend of the ringleader. Michele is a more blithe character who sees the school days as glorious fun, blissfully unaware that she and Romy were the butt of many jokes. Other characters are Heather (Janeane Garlfalo), a depressed and lovelorn chain-smoking teen who has become a wealthy inventor; and Sandy (Alan Cumming) a science nerd in love/lust with Michele who has become a self-made millionaire. Pre-reunion the girls start to panic that their lives are fruitless, so decide to make up histories that will supply them with more appealing profiles. “Romy and Michele’s high school reunion” is a comedy and buddy film that draws heavily on a 1980s soundtrack and fashion and has an appealing duo in the two leads.

results.title: Romper stomper
results.creator_credit: Seon Films, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, Daniel Scharf, Ian Pringle and Geoffrey Wright
results.brief_description: This controversial movie is an exploration of a group of skinheads in the Melbourne inner-city suburb of Footscray who are angry at the Asian-Australians who live amongst them. The film’s evasions are obvious: the narrative it explores belongs as much to the outer suburbs as it does to the multi-ethnic inner suburbs. The director’s scripting and characterization is firmly and deliberately humanistic and sentimental; however the representation of some of the characters appears one dimensional and limited. Despite these shortcomings, “Romper Stomper” is an important Australian film in that it raises complicated issues of class, ethnicity, identity and nationalism. Its reception in the rest of the world was much more critical than its reception in Australia. With excellent performances by Russell Crowe, Daniel Pollock and Jacqueline McKenzie.

results.title: Romper Room
results.brief_description: At last, the longest running and most loved television pre-school program is on video for you to enjoy with your children. Join Miss Susan, Miss Patricia, Miss Helena and Miss Megan, and of course Mr. Do Bee, for all the favourite songs and games from Romper Room.
